column4: hey, im using ubuntu desktop and im having trouble recognizing my usb wireless adapter. how can i add the wireless connection?
the newest one, i just burned it
yes
what is exactly the usb wireless adaptor you use ?
WG111 netgear usb
if you speak french i got a full doc for you :P
ha, no i cant speak french. only english and broken espanol
ok, i'll make you type 2 commands to check this is exactly that card that you're using. Open a terminal and please type "lspci | grep -i wireless"
nothing, it didnt read anything
lspci | grep 802.11 then
still nothing. ill try different usb ports
can you just type "lsusb" and "lspci" and paste the output of both to http://pastebin.ubuntu.com then please ?
just type lsusb and look for something related to wireless, please
yes, i see Bus 002 Device 003: ID 1385:4251 Netgear, Inc
ok, that's really little info but i'll try to find you a driver ;)
thanks, you might be saving be quite a bit of cabling
do you know if your usb key has a number like v2 or v3 written somewhere ? it seems there are 3 versions of this usb key
the box says v2
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper this doc slightly outdated but the idea is there
you'll also need the windows drivers (i suppose you know how to find them)
ill get them off the disk
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=51993 here is a forum topic about someone with the same usb key, too
